content: single_crochet or less to pokeball threading tapestry needle around two legs of the button and through the pokeball stitches then secure the back middle of the button to the pokeball by threading a tapestry needle through the back threads of the button and the legs of the red pokeball edge hide the tail in some stitches and leave the rest of the tail in the pokeball if you are confused you can see me doing this in the video i lined earlier https //www tiktok com/t/ztl87ctaq/ add zipper mark halfway point 3 inches and use sewing pins to hold the zipper to the pokeball with the zipper closed put the zipper pull on the left side pin the zipper bottom black and white and middle either side of the button of the top red with the zipper closed to help improve alignment then unzip and finish pinning the zipper top left and right sides sew zipper with matching thread white and red sew not too close to the teeth if you sew right next to the teeth you will have a hard time closing the zipper when you are finished with everything sew ~ ¼ inches away from the teeth have at least as many stitches as there are crochet stitches pokeball to charzard reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin charizard body the first half of this pattern will be the same shape as the pokeball but you will make it more egg shaped in the later half not a sphere by inserting some single_crochet only row between the decreasing row in the second half the body has many color changes to minimize ugliness see troubleshooting image when working a column of color such as the tail you will work the first and last yellow stitches directly in the stitch the row below see image when you are doing this be careful that you are not adding or decreasing your number of stitches the pattern requires many color changes during the first part of the body carry the nonworking color under your stitches troubleshooting image shows what happens when you have loose gauge and don t carry the yellow yarn under a few orange stitches pokeball to charzard reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin there will be some tilting in the tail color part of the body i tried minimizing this by alternating like you will do when working in the tail but then you get an uneven number of orange stitches on either side of the body and i disliked that even more image is in dragonite colors but the issue is the same pokeball to charzard reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin images are of dragonite but they show the difference between what working in the vs looks like vs not doing it note the number of stitches is different just focus on the ugliness/niceness of the color change make a magic_ring or your preferred method for starting a round start with yellow yarn round 1 6 single_crochet
